Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding no nexus between the applicant's fear of persecution and Convention grounds
Whether the Board erred in finding the applicant failed to rebut the presumption of state protection
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to alleged threats and attacks tied to his wealth and ethnicity in Guyana
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on wealth and ethnicity
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court review under judicial review standards
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant’s testimony focused on wealth as motive for attacks
Evidence_Used: Documentary evidence showing some racial motivation in crimes but not specific to applicant
Application_Basis: Persecution linked to Convention grounds or personal risk of torture/cruel treatment
Evidence_Assessed: General crime data with racial elements in Guyana
Governing_Rule: Claimant must prove persecution linked to Convention grounds or risk of torture/cruel treatment
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to establish nexus between harm and Convention grounds
Insufficient evidence to rebut state protection
Harm_Assessment: Alleged threats and attacks in Guyana
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to alleged threats and attacks tied to his wealth and ethnicity in Guyana
Evidence_Handling: Board considered both testimonial and documentary evidence
Evidence_Issues: Lack of specific evidence linking attacks to ethnicity
Generalized crime data not sufficient to establish personal risk
Evidence_Assessment: Board found attacks were criminal acts unrelated to ethnicity
Decision_Rationale: Findings supported by evidence and not patently unreasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to demonstrate specific targeting based on Convention grounds
